SENT.plain: A case of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis after central venous cannulation is presented
This occurred after a catheter had been in place for 5 days
The patient presented with thrombosis of the left internal jugular vein 4 days after removal of the catheter
Despite anticoagulation, the patient developed symptoms of increased intracranial pressure
Subsequently, a diagnosis of superior sagittal sinus thrombosis was made
The aetiology, diagnosis and management of this uncommon complication of central venous cannulation are discussed
